output.conclusion: This course provides an advanced understanding of transportation engineering principles, equipping students with the knowledge and skills to address complex transportation challenges and contribute to the development of sustainable and efficient transportation systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Transportation Engineering! This course delves into the complexities of modern transportation systems, focusing on advanced techniques and methodologies for planning, design, operation, and management. We will explore key areas such as traffic flow theory, transportation planning, pavement design, and intelligent transportation systems.

chapters.description: Explore macroscopic traffic flow models, including the Lighthill-Whitham-Richards (LWR) model and its applications in traffic simulation and control.
Examine microscopic traffic flow models, such as car-following models and cellular automata models, and their use in understanding driver behavior and traffic dynamics.
Apply queueing theory to analyze and optimize transportation systems, including signalized intersections, toll plazas, and airport terminals.
Investigate advanced transportation planning methods, including activity-based modeling and land use transport interaction models.
Explore advanced demand forecasting techniques, such as discrete choice modeling and microsimulation, for predicting future travel demand.
Study transportation network design principles and optimization techniques for creating efficient and resilient transportation networks.
Examine the properties and characterization of pavement materials, including asphalt, concrete, and aggregates.
Explore advanced pavement design methods, such as mechanistic-empirical pavement design and performance-related specifications.
Study pavement evaluation techniques and pavement management systems for maintaining and rehabilitating pavement infrastructure.
Investigate ITS architectures and communication protocols for enabling real-time data exchange and control in transportation systems.
Explore advanced traffic management systems, including adaptive traffic signal control and incident management strategies.
Study the impact of connected and autonomous vehicles on transportation systems, including safety, efficiency, and environmental sustainability.
Examine sustainable transportation planning principles and strategies for reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting environmentally friendly transportation modes.
Explore transportation economics and finance principles, including cost-benefit analysis, project evaluation, and funding mechanisms.
Study transportation safety and security issues, including crash analysis, risk assessment, and security measures for protecting transportation infrastructure.
